intro: Draba radicata, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in alpine and arctic regions. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba radicata is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in rocky soils and mountainous areas.
